div.p: NARRATOR: Welcome to myPRIME. Before you get started with the course, let's review how to navigate through the myPRIME program.
NARRATOR: At the top of the screen, you'll see the Course Progress bar, the Settings button, and the Secure Logout button.
NARRATOR: The Course Progress bar shows you the percentage of the course you have completed. It will guage your progress as you advance through each of the three units.
NARRATOR: The Settings button allows you to edit your e-mail address, and change your theme.
NARRATOR: Click on the arrow to open and close the menu.
NARRATOR: The Secure Logout button ends your session and protects your personal information from other users on the same computer.
NARRATOR: The main viewing panel in the middle of the screen is where most of the action of the course takes place.
NARRATOR: This is where you'll watch videos, complete interactions, and enter information. Screen instructions appear in the upper area of the viewing panel.
NARRATOR: They'll tell you what to do when you need to provide input.
NARRATOR: If you want to navigate within a lesson you can access the lesson menu by clicking the folder in the lower left corner of the main veiwing panel.
NARRATOR: Note that you cannot jump forward in a lesson using this menu but you can click on a previous video to watch it agin if you missed something.
NARRATOR: Close the lesson menu by clicking the folder icon again.
NARRATOR: The red bar at the bottom of the main viewing panel shows the progress of the current video you are watching.
NARRATOR: This red bar works the same way as the lesson menu you can't skip ahead in the new video but you move backwards if you want to watch something again.
NARRATOR: Closed captioning in available in myPRIME. Click "CC" to turn it on and off. Closed Captioning will open in a new window in your browser.
NARRATOR: At the bottom of your screen, you'll see several icons that you can click on at any time--Support, Tell Me More, My Stuff, and Review.
NARRATOR: Click Support if you have any questions about myPRIME. Enter your information into the form and click Send.
NARRATOR: For technical support you will receive a responce within one business day and for program questions you will recieve a responce within three business days.
NARRATOR: Close the Support tab using the "x" button in the top right corner.
NARRATOR: Click Tell Me More if you'd like to learn more about specific subjects covered in the course. This section contains Frequently Asked Questions, the Glossary, and Research.
NARRATOR: FAQs cover topics that students often ask questions about. Use the scroll bar to move through the list. You can also use the search box to look for a specific word.
NARRATOR: The Glossary tab contains definitions for common terms that are often used in myPRIME.
NARRATOR: You can either scroll through the list, click on a letter at the top of the screen to veiw terms beginning with that letter, or use the search box.
NARRATOR: The Research tab contains references for the studies that support the information in myPRIME.
NARRATOR: Click on a specific reference to see the full citation.
NARRATOR: The My Stuff section contains the personal notes and reflections that you enter throughout the course.
NARRATOR: You can add notes at the end of each lesson and you will be asked to enter reflection questions throughout the course.
NARRATOR: The Review section contains the Course Menu and Practice Area.
NARRATOR: Lessons will become available on the list once you complete them in the course.
NARRATOR: If you want to review a particular lesson in the course, just click on the title, read the description and select Take Me to this Lesson.
NARRATOR: You can access this tour at anytime by clicking Support followed by the Take Tour button. let's get started!
